page.title: 17ALL SAINTS PARISH CHURCH
page.content: All Saints Parish Church GR 453003 was built in 1821. There have been 3 churches on this site. Special features include a 3 tier pulpit,boxed pews and a nodding stick which was used by the parish clerk in days gone by to wake people up.There is also a unique George VI coat of arms The church holds 109 people and recently family services have been introduced by the vicar, Rev S Pix. On Oct 20 1985 an inter-faith service was held at the church organised by the Cleveland branch of U.N. Assoc'n. In addition to the reading of the U.N. Charter a major part of the service was devoted to readings by members of the Baha'i, Buddhist, Christian, Hindu, Moslem,Jewish and Sikh faiths.
